content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

ðŸ˜Š Here's a possible implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width = 10)
    result = ""
    len = 0

    for word in words
        if (len + length(word)) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            len = 0
        end
        result *= word * " "
        len += length(word) + 1
    end

    return result
end
```
ðŸ¤– Here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
words = ["This", "is", "a", "test"]
result = wrap_string(words, 20)
println(result)
```
The output would be:
```
This is a test
```
ðŸ¤– This example has the words `["This", "is", "a", "test"]` with a maximum text width of 20 characters. The result is printed on a new line when it exceeds 20 characters (which happens after adding `"This is"`) ðŸ˜Š
